analyzed: kathāvatthu
translated: Points of Controversy

analyzed: niyāma paṇṇāsaka
translated: The fiftieth chapter

analyzed: sattama vagga
translated: The seventh section

analyzed: saṅgahita kathā
translated: The section on included

original: Natthi keci dhammā kehici dhammehi saṅgahitāti?
analyzed: natthi keci dhammā kehici dhammehi saṅgahitā ati
translated: Are there any things that are not included in any things?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “Yes.”

original: Nanu atthi keci dhammā kehici dhammehi gaṇanaṁ gacchanti uddesaṁ gacchanti pariyāpannāti?
analyzed: nanu atthi keci dhammā kehici dhammehi gaṇanam gacchanti uddesam gacchanti pariyāpannā ati
translated: “But don’t some things count, are recited, and are included in some things?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci atthi keci dhammā kehici dhammehi gaṇanaṁ gacchanti uddesaṁ gacchanti pariyāpannā, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci atthi keci dhammā kehici dhammehi gaṇanam gacchanti uddesam gacchanti pariyāpannāḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”

analyzed: natthi keci dhammā kehici dhammehi saṅgahitā ati
translated: “So, although there are some things that count, are recited, and are included in some things, still you say that there are some things that are not included in any things.

analyzed: cakkhu āyatanam katama khandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: In which of the aggregates is the eye sense-sphere counted?”

original: Rūpakkhandhagaṇanaṁ gacchatīti.🔽Hañci cakkhāyatanaṁ rūpakkhandhagaṇanaṁ gacchati, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: rūpa kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati iti  hañci cakkha āyatanam rūpa kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “It is counted in the form aggregate.”

analyzed: cakkhāyatanam rūpakkhandhena saṅgahitanti
translated: “So, although the eye sense-sphere is counted in the form aggregate, still you say that the eye sense-sphere is included in the form aggregate.

analyzed: sotāyatanam pe  ghāna āyatanam pe
translated: In which of the aggregates is the ear sense-sphere …🔽the nose sense-sphere …

analyzed: jivhā āyatanam pe
translated: the tongue sense-sphere …

analyzed: kāya āyatanam katama khandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: In which of the aggregates is the body sense-sphere counted?”

analyzed: rūpa kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: It is counted in the aggregate of form.

original: Hañci kāyāyatanaṁ rūpakkhandhagaṇanaṁ gacchati, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci kāya āyatanam rūpa kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati tena vata re vattabbe
translated: Now, does the body sense-sphere come under the aggregate of form? Well, then, you must say—

analyzed: kāya āyatanam rūpa kkhandhena saṅgahitan ti  rūpa āyatanam pe  saddāyatanam pe
translated: “The body sense-sphere is included in the aggregate of form.”🔽Does the form sense-sphere …🔽Does the sound sense-sphere …

analyzed: gandha āyatanam pe
translated: Does the smell sense-sphere …

analyzed: rasāyatanam pe
translated: Does the taste sense-sphere …

analyzed: phoṭṭhabba āyatanam katama khandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: Does the tangibles sense-sphere come under which aggregate?

analyzed: rūpa kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: It is counted in the aggregate of form.

original: Hañci phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ rūpakkhandhagaṇanaṁ gacchati, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci phoṭṭhabba āyatanam rūpa kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati tena vata re vattabbe
translated: Now, does the tangibles sense-sphere come under the aggregate of form? Well, then, you must say—

analyzed: phoṭṭhabba āyatanam rūpa kkhandhena saṅgahitanti
translated: “The tangibles sense-sphere is included in the aggregate of form.”

analyzed: sukhā vedanā katama khandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: Does pleasant feeling come under which aggregate?

analyzed: vedanā kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: It is counted in the aggregate of feeling.

original: Hañci sukhā vedanā vedanākkhandhagaṇanaṁ gacchati, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci sukhā vedanā vedanā khandha gaṇanam gacchati tena vata re vattabbe
translated: Now, does pleasant feeling come under the aggregate of feeling? Well, then, you must say—

analyzed: sukhā vedanā vedanā kkhandhena saṅgahitā iti
translated: “Pleasant feeling is included in the aggregate of feeling.”

original: Dukkhā vedanā …pe… adukkhamasukhā vedanā katamakkhandhagaṇanaṁ gacchatīti?
analyzed: dukkhā vedanā pe adukkhamasukhā vedanā katama khandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: Does painful feeling … Does neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling belong to the reckoning of which aggregate?”

analyzed: vedanā kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: “It belongs to the reckoning of the feeling aggregate.”

original: Hañci adukkhamasukhā vedanā vedanākkhandhagaṇanaṁ gacchati, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci adukkham asukhā vedanā vedanā kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “If neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling belongs to the reckoning of the feeling aggregate, then it is proper to say:

analyzed: adukkham asukhā vedanā vedanā kkhandhena saṅgahitā ati
translated: ‘Neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is included in the feeling aggregate.’

analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā saññā katama khandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: “Does perception born of eye contact belong to the reckoning of which aggregate?”

analyzed: saññā kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: “It belongs to the reckoning of the perception aggregate.”

original: Hañci cakkhusamphassajā saññā saññākkhandhagaṇanaṁ gacchati, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci cakkhu samphassa jā saññā saññā kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “If perception born of eye contact belongs to the reckoning of the perception aggregate, then it is proper to say:

analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā saññā saññā kkhandhena saṅgahitā ti
translated: ‘Perception born of eye contact is included in the perception aggregate.’

analyzed: sota samphassa jā saññā pe
translated: “Does perception born of ear contact …

analyzed: manaḥ samphassa jā saññā katama khandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: Does perception born of mind contact belong to the reckoning of which aggregate?”

analyzed: saññā kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: “It belongs to the reckoning of the perception aggregate.”

original: Hañci manosamphassajā saññā saññākkhandhagaṇanaṁ gacchati, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci manaḥ samphassa jā saññā saññā kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “If perception born of mind contact belongs to the reckoning of the perception aggregate, then it is proper to say:

analyzed: manaḥ samphassa jā saññā saññā kkhandhena saṅgahitā ti
translated: “Perception born of mind-contact is included in the perception component.”

analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā cetanā pe
translated: “Is volition born of eye-contact …

analyzed: manaḥ samphassa jā cetanā katama khandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: … born of mind-contact reckoned as which component?”

analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: “It’s reckoned as the volitions component.”

original: Hañci manosamphassajā cetanā saṅkhārakkhandhagaṇanaṁ gacchati, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci manaḥ samphassa jā cetanā saṅkhāra kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “If volition born of mind-contact is reckoned as the volitions component, then it should be said that

analyzed: manaḥ samphassa jā cetanā saṅkhāra kkhandhena saṅgahitā ati
translated: ‘volition born of mind-contact is included in the volitions component.’

analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇam pe
translated: “Is eye-consciousness …

analyzed: manaḥ viññāṇam katama khandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: … mind-consciousness reckoned as which component?”

analyzed: viññāṇa kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati iti
translated: “It’s reckoned as the consciousness component.”

original: Hañci manoviññāṇaṁ viññāṇakkhandhagaṇanaṁ gacchati, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci manaḥ viññāṇam viññāṇa kkhandha gaṇanam gacchati tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “If mind-consciousness is reckoned as the consciousness component, then it should be said that

analyzed: manaḥ viññāṇam viññāṇa kkhandhena saṅgahitanti
translated: ‘mind-consciousness is included in the consciousness component.’

original: Yathā dāmena vā yottena vā dve balībaddā saṅgahitā, sikkāya piṇḍapāto saṅgahito, sā gaddulena saṅgahito;
analyzed: yathā dāmena vā yottena vā dve balībaddā saṅgahitā sikkāya piṇḍapātaḥ saṅgahitaḥ sā gaddulena saṅgahitaḥ
translated: “Just as two oxen yoked by a single yoke or two sheaves of grass or sticks bound together are said to be ‘bound together,’ and a lump of food is said to be ‘included’ in a bowl,

original: evameva te dhammā tehi dhammehi saṅgahitāti?
analyzed: evam eva te dhammā tehi dhammehi saṅgahitā ati
translated: are these things included in those things in the same way?”🔽“Yes.”

original: Hañci dāmena vā yottena vā dve balībaddā saṅgahitā, sikkāya piṇḍapāto saṅgahito, sā gaddulena saṅgahito, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci dāmena vā yottena vā dve balībaddā saṅgahitā sikkāya piṇḍapātaḥ saṅgahitaḥ sā gaddulena saṅgahitaḥ tena vata re vattabbe
translated: Are two animals caught in a snare or a trap caught by the rope or the trap? Is almsfood caught in a bowl caught by the bowl? Is a snake caught in a snake-basket caught by the snake-basket? So how could it be said that there are things that are caught by other things?

analyzed: atthi keci dhammā kehici dhammehi saṅgahitā ati
translated: “Are there any things that are caught by other things?”

analyzed: saṅgahita kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Discussion of Being Caught is finished.
